p: The analysis above alluded to the availability of greater testing over time as one potential way to interpret the arrival of “the cavalry” at the right point in time. We think that is the best interpretation, rather than changing the cost or death curves. Changing the cost or death curves in response to testing risks muddling the distinction between a mass quarantine policy, such as indiscriminate stay-at-home orders, from specific quarantines, which discriminate on detected infections, and represent business as usual for any detected sickness (i.e., stay home if you are infected).
